thread.title: Ex-Liverpool, Sunderland and QPR striker Djibril Cisse retires from football… to become a DJ
thread.title_full: Ex-Liverpool, Sunderland and QPR striker Djibril Cisse retires from football… to become a DJ

author: rforrester
title: Ex-Liverpool, Sunderland and QPR striker Djibril Cisse retires from football… to become a DJ
text:
Comments FORMER Liverpool striker Djibril Cisse will swap the football pitch for the DJ decks. 
The 35-year-old officially announced he was hanging up his boots having failed to find a new club this season. Getty Images Djibril Cisse has announced he has hung up his boots at the age of 35 AP 6 The Frenchman scored 10 goals in 35 games whilst on loan at Sunderland 
And the striker, who will fondly be remembered by Liverpool fans for scoring a penalty in the Champions League final win over AC Milan, has decided to pursue his other passions. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Liverpool gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Frenchman will kick on with his DJ career alongside working to promote his clothing brand ‘Mr Lenoir.’ 
Cisse previously quit football in October 2015 having failed to shrug off a hip injury. 
But after successful surgery, he was open to offers to join a new club but failed to find a potential club after leaving Reunion Premier League side Saint-Pierroise. Fame Flynet 6 The 35-year-old will pursue his other passions including working on his clothing brand 
The ex-Sunderland man is already building up quite a reputation in the music industry having played a DJ set ahead of a Mariah Carey gig in Paris last year. 
Reported by Liverpool Echo , Cisse said: “I loved being a footballer, and so far the ball has been my life. 
“I would have liked to continue playing but I must admit today that football is over. GC Images Djibril Cisse was even on the decks to launch Mariah Carey’s gig last year related articles Cantona, Suarez, Balotelli... As M'Baye Niang joins Watford, take a look at 13 other bad-boys CHINESE CHEiCK AWAY Newcastle's Cheick Tiote joins Chinese second division side Beijing Enterprises on two-year deal time to change Arsenal should ditch Mesut Ozil, get tough with Arsene Wenger and behave like a big club FUN AND GAMES Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez play LUDO with Barcelona team-mates instead of going out partying Not so hot, Rod See the moment Jese Rodriguez misses a three-yard sitter on debut for Las Palmas in Granada defeat Yaw a Star Porto in talks with Manchester City over a loan deal with an option to buy for youngster Yaw Yeboah Barca to gazump United Barca are to go head-to-head with Manchester United for Benfica duo Lindelof and Semedo AGUERO RACE IS ON Real Madrid and Barcelona both watching Sergio Aguero's situation at City closely as summer move nears Kant live without 'em Forget Costa, Hazard, Kane and Alli, Chelsea and Spurs' success is down to Kante and Wanyama 'IT BUGS ME' Asmir Begovic frustrated with back-up role to Thibaut Courtois at Chelsea but will fight for trophy glory 'I'm joining Blues' Alvaro Morata sensationally tells Real Madrid he wants to join Antonio Conte's Chelsea this summer Poor Form Jesse Lingard reveals Manchester United’s £89million ace Paul Pogba is ALWAYS late for training Times Newspapers Ltd Djibril Cisse also had a stint at QPR where he almost dented Man City’s title hopes by levelling the score in 2012 Reuters 6 The ex-striker launched his own album in 2006 called “The DJ Insii” 
“With the same passion, I will devote myself wholeheartedly to my career as DJ, producer and consultant, as well as developing my clothing brand. 
“Thank you for all your support. The adventure continues, another life begins. A lion never dies.” 
Cisse won five major club honours during his playing career including the FA Cup with Liverpool, where he scored the opening goal, a Champions League winners medal, the French cup with Auxerre and the Greek League and domestic cup with Panathinaikos. Liverpool keeper Simon Mignolet drops a corner which leads to a Hull goal
